intro: Ferulago transsilvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian fumitory, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Ferulago transsilvanica is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
